questionBank.question: Radiocarbon is produced in the atmosphere as a result of

options.a: collision between fast neutrons and nitrogen nuclei present in the atmosphere
options.b: action of ultraviolet light from the sun on atmospheric oxygen
options.c: action of solar radiations particularly cosmic rays on carbon dioxide present in the atmosphere

questionBank.question: It is easier to roll a stone up a sloping road than to lift it vertical upwards because

options.a: work done in rolling is more than in lifting
options.b: work done in lifting the stone is equal to rolling it
options.c: work done in both is same but the rate of doing work is less in rolling
options.d: work done in rolling a stone is less than in lifting it

questionBank.question: The absorption of ink by blotting paper involves

options.c: diffusion of ink through the blotting

questionBank.question: Siphon will fail to work if

options.a: the densities of the liquid in the two vessels are equal
options.b: the level of the liquid in the two vessels are at the same height
options.c: both its limbs are of unequal length
options.d: the temperature of the liquids in the two vessels are the same

questionBank.question: Large transformers, when used for some time, become very hot and are cooled by circulating oil. The heating of the transformer is due to

options.a: the heating effect of current alone
options.c: both the heating effect of current and hysteresis loss

questionBank.question: Nuclear sizes are expressed in a unit named
Light year is a unit of

options.a: unequal heating of different parts of the atmosphere
options.c: depletion of ozone layer in the atmosphere
options.d: equal heating of different parts of the atmosphere

questionBank.question: Light from the Sun reaches us in nearly

options.a: they emit light of a constant intensity
options.b: their distance from the earth does not change with time
options.c: they are very far away from the earth resulting in decrease in intensity of light
options.d: they are nearer to earth and hence we receive a greater amount of light and, therefore minor variations in the intensity are not noticeable
